channel.title: Does anyone know the total gigga bytes of windows XP made in 2003-2004?
channel.description:
Mod please move to the appropriate section if this is in the wrong section.
Well, i'm not sure if this guy has been ripping off my family for repairing my computer. Idk how to check for the software but i know 74.5GB is rip off somehow. If anyone can tell me what the max GB of a windows xp computer made during 2003-2004 please post! I really need this info to be sure he not ripping us off.
And before this guy came we had another computer repairing named Mike who upgraded my computer to vista (first ever version that had no side bar, but vista buttons and stuff), and we payed way less then what we pay for now.
[b]PS[/b]: If your not understanding this, then post so I can try and explain it better.

item.title: Does anyone know the total gigga bytes of windows XP made in 2003-2004?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

I think Mike, the one who upgraded your computer to the first vista, may have only installed a vista theme?

Read full topic

item.title: Does anyone know the total gigga bytes of windows XP made in 2003-2004?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC

@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

item.source: Does anyone know the total gigga bytes of windows XP made in 2003-2004?

item.title: Does anyone know the total gigga bytes of windows XP made in 2003-2004?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Are you foreign?

A computer is a computer, not a windows xp?

You are asking if a 74.5gigabyte hard drive is small for one made in 2003-2004, the answer is no really. You can store quite a bit with that. Most computers these days come with 320gb hard drives.

If you manage to fill all of the 74.5gb up with shit then i’d be surprised.

And there isn’t really a max GB hard drive for a computer…

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone know the total gigga bytes of windows XP made in 2003-2004?
